channel.title: Comments on: Forgotten art of using what you know
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.content:encoded:
Nice. This is why my continuous delivery process, with all of it’s bells and whistles, fell back on a basic (hah) VBScript file to check if a site was available. I was way over the time I had allotted for the exercise and while I would have preferred to do it with powershell, I knew I could bang it out in a few minutes in VBScript (the limitation being my knowledge of powershell, not powershell itself).

That said, I also have a tendency to force myself to try new technologies or try to follow standards when I can, so I try to make sure my reasons are valid if I find myself falling back to an older technology in a pinch (and not just laziness on my part). You’re either improving or sliding backwards.
